Row.Text: CivBE is still alive thanks to mods. Support us using the hashtags #CivBE_Essence and #CivBEAlive. Thank you for using our Mod for the 'Rising tide' and 'Exoplanets' expansions.

Replace.Text: {1_Num} HP
City hit points: {1_Num} HP
Damages Alien Units within 2 squares.
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] by your surplus Health [ICON_HEALTH].[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]
Each city (or puppet city [ICON_PUPPET]) you have, other than the capital [ICON_CAPITAL], will increase the acquisition costs of Virtues by {1_Num:number "#.#"} %.
Each city (or puppet city) [ICON_PUPPET]) you have, other than the capital [ICON_CAPITAL], will increase the acquisition costs of Sciences by {1_Num:number "#.#"} %.
+{1_Num}% to Production [ICON_PRODUCTION] for Military Units.

Row.Text: Random planet with very little water[NEWLINE](DO NOT USE, In development)
The game will choose a planet with little water for you to play on
Random Earth-like planet[NEWLINE](DO NOT USE, In development)
The game will choose a planet balanced between continents and water for you to play on
Random pretty aquatic planet[NEWLINE](DO NOT USE, In development)
The game will choose a planet with a lot of water for you to play on

Replace.Text: Number of teams
Unlocked-Ice_Age
Unlocked-Inland_Sea #
Unlocked-Tiny_Islands
Usermod-Migugh-Skirmish # (Restored file)

Row.Text: A vast map dominated by a large continent connected with sparse oceans in the middle of the map.
A map to navigate an endless ocean with only sparse lands emerging on them some occasional cliffs.

Replace.Text: +1 Food [ICON_FOOD] in each city. Create colonist units twice as fast.
+1 Production [ICON_PRODUCTION] in each city. All Units +10% Strength [ICON_STRENGTH] and Ranged Strength [ICON_RANGE_STRENGTH] in friendly territory.

Row.Text: TODO:Tips #1:[NEWLINE]Melee units receive a 10% bonus to combat strength for each friendly unit adjacent to the enemy unit they are attacking. Mounted units (tanks and cavalry) are faster and good at ambushing so they also get an extra 20% for flanking when you attack with them.

Replace.Text: Tips:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The Dome, Node, and Biowell [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_IMPROVEMENT]improvements[ENDCOLOR] cannot be built adjacent to each other, they must have a large space apart in order to develop properly. Dome gives extra yield near montains, rivers or on a hill; Node reduce the health of enemy units; Biowell needs river or fresh water to be deployed.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Generators give +1 energy on hills; Mines use 1 energy per turn, only can be built on hills or in special resources and cannot be built in the sea (except in Minerals); so in the sea you need to search for Reefs to get production.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Trading is only available from 1 city, and for each 10 population you can add an extra route; trading is very difficult due to the hostile landscape and the fact that it is an uninhabited alien planet.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]In the swamps and tundra there is a lot of unknown biodiversity that allows us to learn new things, so those places have a science bonus (if you decide to work those spaces to exploit it and collect samples).[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Do Expeditions with your explorers to be able to recover abandoned artifacts. You will also find some alien ruins that will provide us with culture and research when investigating the operation of the facility abandoned years ago.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Land is more interesting than sea, city near rivers can build the especial building "Dam" too, in compensation, aquatic bases give more culture (+50%) and have big bonuses for creating aquatic units but they are 20% easier to destroy.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]When a a city is conquered, the local population will be discontented. This discontent manifests itself in the "Martial Law" phase. The length of this phase depends on how much population has the city.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]If you want the revolts phase in the conquered cities, you need to became the city a "Puppet" but it will be automanaged (can be taken the control later) or "Raze" the city but the city will be full destroyed.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Repairing a unit per turn is +10 HP on enemy or neutral territory, +20HP on friendly territory, +30 HP inside a city. Miasma reduce -10HP to the unit in the tile except for alien units that health them +10HP per turn.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Units in a Swamp have an additional movement cost and lows attack (-10%), Hills provide 25% defensive bonuses, Forests hinder movement, and Rivers can create choke points (-40% penalty to attack) and flanking attack bonus of 10%.Units attack output is reduced by the same percentage of damaged unit. There are not air units available.

Tips:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The Dome, Node, and Biowell [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_IMPROVEMENT]improvements[ENDCOLOR] cannot be built adjacent to each other, they must have a large space apart in order to develop properly. Dome gives extra yield near montains, rivers or on a hill; Node reduce the health of enemy units; Biowell needs river or fresh water to be deployed.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Generators give +1 energy on hills; Mines use 1 energy per turn, only can be built on hills or in special resources and cannot be built in the sea (except in Minerals); so in the sea you need to search for Reefs to get production.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Trading is only available from 1 city, and for each 10 population you can add an extra route; trading is very difficult due to the hostile landscape and the fact that it is an uninhabited alien planet.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]In the swamps and tundra there is a lot of unknown biodiversity that allows us to learn new things, so those places have a science bonus (if you decide to work those spaces to exploit it and collect samples).[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Do Expeditions with your explorers to be able to recover abandoned artifacts. You will also find some alien ruins that will provide us with culture and research when investigating the operation of the facility abandoned years ago.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Land is more interesting than sea, city near rivers can build the especial building "Dam" too, in compensation, aquatic bases give more culture (+50%) and have big bonuses for creating aquatic units but they are 20% easier to destroy.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]When a a city is conquered, the local population will be discontented. This discontent manifests itself in the "Martial Law" phase. The length of this phase depends on how much population has the city.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]If you want the revolts phase in the conquered cities, you need to became the city a "Puppet" but it will be automanaged (can be taken the control later) or "Raze" the city but the city will be full destroyed.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Repairing a unit per turn is +10 HP on enemy or neutral territory, +20HP on friendly territory, +30 HP inside a city. Miasma reduce -10HP to the unit in the tile except for alien units that health them +10HP per turn.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Units in a Swamp have an additional movement cost and lows attack (-10%), Hills provide 25% defensive bonuses, Forests hinder movement, and Rivers can create choke points (-40% penalty to attack) and flanking attack bonus of 10%.Units attack output is reduced by the same percentage of damaged unit. There are not air units available.

Tips:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The Dome, Node, and Biowell [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_IMPROVEMENT]improvements[ENDCOLOR] cannot be built adjacent to each other, they must have a large space apart in order to develop properly. Dome gives extra yield near montains, rivers or on a hill; Node reduce the health of enemy units; Biowell needs river or fresh water to be deployed.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Generators give +1 energy on hills; Mines use 1 energy per turn, only can be built on hills or in special resources and cannot be built in the sea (except in Minerals); so in the sea you need to search for Reefs to get production.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Trading is only available from 1 city, and for each 10 population you can add an extra route; trading is very difficult due to the hostile landscape and the fact that it is an uninhabited alien planet.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]In the swamps and tundra there is a lot of unknown biodiversity that allows us to learn new things, so those places have a science bonus (if you decide to work those spaces to exploit it and collect samples).[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Do Expeditions with your explorers to be able to recover abandoned artifacts. You will also find some alien ruins that will provide us with culture and research when investigating the operation of the facility abandoned years ago.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Land is more interesting than sea, city near rivers can build the especial building "Dam" too, in compensation, aquatic bases give more culture (+50%) and have big bonuses for creating aquatic units but they are 20% easier to destroy.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]When a a city is conquered, the local population will be discontented. This discontent manifests itself in the "Martial Law" phase. The length of this phase depends on how much population has the city.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]If you want the revolts phase in the conquered cities, you need to became the city a "Puppet" but it will be automanaged (can be taken the control later) or "Raze" the city but the city will be full destroyed.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Repairing a unit per turn is +10 HP on enemy or neutral territory, +20HP on friendly territory, +30 HP inside a city. Miasma reduce -10HP to the unit in the tile except for alien units that health them +10HP per turn.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Units in a Swamp have an additional movement cost and lows attack (-10%), Hills provide 25% defensive bonuses, Forests hinder movement, and Rivers can create choke points (-40% penalty to attack) and flanking attack bonus of 10%.Units attack output is reduced by the same percentage of damaged unit. There are not air units available.

Tips:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The Dome, Node, and Biowell [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_IMPROVEMENT]improvements[ENDCOLOR] cannot be built adjacent to each other, they must have a large space apart in order to develop properly. Dome gives extra yield near montains, rivers or on a hill; Node reduce the health of enemy units; Biowell needs river or fresh water to be deployed.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Generators give +1 energy on hills; Mines use 1 energy per turn, only can be built on hills or in special resources and cannot be built in the sea (except in Minerals); so in the sea you need to search for Reefs to get production.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Trading is only available from 1 city, and for each 10 population you can add an extra route; trading is very difficult due to the hostile landscape and the fact that it is an uninhabited alien planet.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]In the swamps and tundra there is a lot of unknown biodiversity that allows us to learn new things, so those places have a science bonus (if you decide to work those spaces to exploit it and collect samples).[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Do Expeditions with your explorers to be able to recover abandoned artifacts. You will also find some alien ruins that will provide us with culture and research when investigating the operation of the facility abandoned years ago.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Land is more interesting than sea, city near rivers can build the especial building "Dam" too, in compensation, aquatic bases give more culture (+50%) and have big bonuses for creating aquatic units but they are 20% easier to destroy.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]When a a city is conquered, the local population will be discontented. This discontent manifests itself in the "Martial Law" phase. The length of this phase depends on how much population has the city.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]If you want the revolts phase in the conquered cities, you need to became the city a "Puppet" but it will be automanaged (can be taken the control later) or "Raze" the city but the city will be full destroyed.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Repairing a unit per turn is +10 HP on enemy or neutral territory, +20HP on friendly territory, +30 HP inside a city. Miasma reduce -10HP to the unit in the tile except for alien units that health them +10HP per turn.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Units in a Swamp have an additional movement cost and lows attack (-10%), Hills provide 25% defensive bonuses, Forests hinder movement, and Rivers can create choke points (-40% penalty to attack) and flanking attack bonus of 10%.Units attack output is reduced by the same percentage of damaged unit. There are not air units available.
TODO:When improved with a[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_IMPROVEMENT]{@1_ImprovementName}[ENDCOLOR]:[NEWLINE](Mines add an additional +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION])
Roe
Molluscs
This mysterious ruins cannot let you do any improvements on it but give +2 Culture [ICON_CULTURE] +2 Science [ICON_RESEARCH]
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This Improvement cannot be adjacent to other Improvements of the same type[ENDCOLOR]

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_IMPROVEMENT]A tile improvement[ENDCOLOR] that can be built by [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_UNIT]Workers[ENDCOLOR] units on [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_RESOURCE]Coral [ICON_CORAL][ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_RESOURCE]Algae [ICON_ALGAE][ENDCOLOR] resources. Gives:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] 2 to Production [ICON_PRODUCTION] and 1 to Energy [ICON_ENERGY] from Coral [ICON_CORAL][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] 2 to Food [ICON_FOOD] and 1 to Energy [ICON_ENERGY] from Algae [ICON_ALGAE]

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_IMPROVEMENT]Tile Improvements[ENDCOLOR] may have special bonuses based on the square they are built on.[NEWLINE]The Dome gains +1 Culture [ICON_CULTURE] when built on a riverside, +1 Culture [ICON_CULTURE] if the terrain has a Hill, and +1 Culture [ICON_CULTURE] for each adjacent Mountain Terrain.[NEWLINE]The Node gains a +1 [ICON_ENERGY] Energy bonus when adjacent to a City.[NEWLINE]The Generator can be built on a Hill to generate +1 [ICON_ENERGY] Energy.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]There are also exceptions.[NEWLINE]The Biowell can only be built on tiles that have a river or lake with fresh water.[NEWLINE]In addition, the Dome, the Node and the Biowell cannot be built adjacent to other Biowells of the same type.
[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_IMPROVEMENT]Tile improvements[ENDCOLOR] that can be built by [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_UNIT]Workers[ENDCOLOR] units in a flat area in land or deep-sea methane hydrate extraction factories.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_IMPROVEMENT]Tile improvements[ENDCOLOR] that can be built by [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_UNIT]Worker[ENDCOLOR] units on land, near rivers but they cannot be adjacent. Gives:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] +1 to Health [ICON_HEALTH_1]

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_IMPROVEMENT]Tile improvements[ENDCOLOR] that can be built by [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_UNIT]Worker[ENDCOLOR] units on any terrain but cannot be adjacent. Gives:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] +10 to city hit points[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] +1 Culture [ICON_CULTURE] if next to a river[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] +1 Culture [ICON_CULTURE] if on a hill[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] +1 Culture [ICON_CULTURE] for each adjacent Mountain

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_IMPROVEMENT]Tile improvements[ENDCOLOR] that [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_UNIT]Worker[ENDCOLOR] units can build on any terrain but cannot be adjacent. Gives:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] 10 damage to nearby enemy units

A piloted light combat armor with a variety of mounted weapons. It is a melee unit that [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]attacks 2 times[ENDCOLOR]. It also [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]displaces the defending unit from the hit when attacking[ENDCOLOR].

[COLOR_SUPREMACY_AFFINITY]Travels through canyons and shallow water.[ENDCOLOR] The ultimate exponent of Supremacy [ICON_SUPREMACY]. A highly advanced robotic walker that packs exceptional ranged heavy weaponry. It is an extremely versatile unit, suited to any role on the battlefield.
A floating hybrid of machine and organism capable of delivering powerful attacks at extremely long range.
A squad of stormtroopers mounted on a semi-autonomous mobile combat platform. It is a fast, aggressive raiding and reconnaissance unit.
[COLOR_PURITY_AFFINITY]+30% defense against ranged units attacks.[ENDCOLOR] An armored soldier with augmented armor. It is a very tough melee shock unit.

[COLOR_SUPREMACY_AFFINITY]Travels through canyons and shallow water.[ENDCOLOR] A versatile melee attack robotic soldier. It also gains a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bonus when attacking unfortified enemies.[ENDCOLOR]
A fragile but deadly melee unit that uses [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]invisibility[ENDCOLOR] to flank and ambush enemies. It is a melee unit specialized in hunting and killing.

A very fortified but very slow colossal unit, capable of covering nearby troops. It is a formidable defensive unit. Additionally gains a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bonus when attacking fortified enemies.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_HARMONY_AFFINITY]Always heals every turn, without needing to rest.[ENDCOLOR] A soldier whose physical capabilities have been genetically enhanced.

[COLOR_PURITY_AFFINITY]+30% defense against ranged units attacks.[ENDCOLOR] The ultimate embodiment of [ICON_PURITY] Purity. A giant, heavily armed platform that [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]floats above the ground, allowing it to traverse canyons and water[ENDCOLOR]. It is a very powerful ranged combat unit.

[COLOR_PURITY_AFFINITY]+30% defense against ranged units attacks.[ENDCOLOR] An armored attack vehicle that [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]floats above the ground, allowing it to avoid cannons and water[ENDCOLOR]. It is a powerful and agile melee combat unit.
A living, bio-engineered orbital unit that can move between deployments and provides limited orbital coverage around where it is.
[COLOR_SUPREMACY_AFFINITY]Traverses canyons and shallow waters.[ENDCOLOR]A robotic artillery platform with a very long range but needs to be deployed. It is a very powerful ranged combat unit.
A ranged combat unit that [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]its missiles can fly over terrain obstacles[ENDCOLOR]. Specializes in reducing city defenses but needs to be deployed.

A ranged naval unit. Specialized in stealth, it is very good at assaulting and ambushing, but has limited attack speed and range and relies on its [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]invisibility[ENDCOLOR] to outwit enemies.
[COLOR_HARMONY_AFFINITY]Always heals itself every turn, never needing to rest.[ENDCOLOR]Human soldiers mounted on genetically enhanced, domesticated alien lifeforms. It is a fast melee attack unit.

[COLOR_HARMONY_AFFINITY]It always heals itself every turn, without needing to rest.[ENDCOLOR] The ultimate exponent of Harmony [ICON_HARMONY]. A monstrous bio-engineered creature based on alien life forms. It is a huge and very powerful melee combat unit.

Orbital Unit. When in orbit, it establishes contact with Old Earth, as part of the victory for emancipation and the promised land. Every city within range receives +20% to overall [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
Orbital Unit. +1 to [ICON_FOOD] Food in your tiles.
Orbital Unit. Spawns 2 new Strategic Resources in unimproved tiles during its lifecycle.
Orbital Unit. +1 Culture [ICON_CULTURE] on your tiles.
Orbital Unit. +1 Science [ICON_RESEARCH] on your tiles. Every city within range receives +20% Science [ICON_RESEARCH] overall.
Orbital Unit. Removes 50% of the Intrigue from any city within range and receives 50% less Intrigue from enemy Secret Agent activity.
Orbital Unit. +2 to Production [ICON_PRODUCTION] on that tile. Every city within range receives +5% to Production [ICON_PRODUCTION] overall.
+33% Defense to Naval units against ranged attacks

Row.Text: Mounted unit: you get an extra +20% for flanking when attacking if you surround the enemy with other units.
[COLOR_HARMONY_AFFINITY]Self-Healing[ENDCOLOR]: Always heals every turn without needing to rest.
[COLOR_PURITY_AFFINITY]Defense shield[ENDCOLOR]: +30% defense against ranged units attacks.
May attack and capture a sea city.
[COLOR_SUPREMACY_AFFINITY]Mechanized Walker[ENDCOLOR]: Traverses canyons and shallow waters deep.

Replace.Text: Dam|Dams

To prevent the flooding of rivers adjacent to cities, a dam was needed. It also provided fresh water in times of need and also served to obtain energy in a simple way. This was very easy to do if the city was close to a river, which made its construction and maintenance easier. The first dams were identical to those on Old Earth, a concrete structure with turbines to produce electricity, easy to maintain, managed by a few engineers.
[COLOR_RED]Can only be built in cities with a river[ENDCOLOR]
